channel.title: Miscs on Beshoy Kamel
channel.description: Recent content in Miscs on Beshoy Kamel

item.description: Works Cited “11% of Canadians Aged 15-24 Met Criteria for Depression: StatsCan.” CBC News, CBC, 18 Jan. 2017, www.cbc.ca/news/health/depression-suicidal-thoughts-1.3940621. This 2017 CBC News report is based on 4,031 respondents aged 15 to 24, which when extrapolated represents more than 4.4 million young people. It reveals a disturbingly high number of young Canadians (aged 15-24) experiencing depression (11%). The report further emphasizes the severity of the issue by highlighting that suicide, often linked to depression, is the second leading cause of death in this age group.
